title: Data Residency
text: Personal Identifiable Information (PII) and transactional data for Qatari customers must be stored on servers physically located in Qatar. Cloud providers must have Qatar-based data centers or demonstrate compliance through approved data hosting arrangements.

title: Source of Funds Verification
text: For high-risk transactions or transactions exceeding QAR 50,000, financial institutions must verify the source of funds and source of wealth, maintaining detailed records for at least 5 years.

title: Compliance Officer Appointment
text: A designated, independent Compliance Officer must be appointed and approved by QCB prior to licensing. The officer must have direct reporting to the Board and adequate resources to perform compliance functions.

title: AML/CFT Policy Framework
text: Board-approved Anti-Money Laundering and Combating the Financing of Terrorism (AML/CFT) policy with comprehensive monitoring rules, transaction screening, and reporting procedures is mandatory before licensing approval.

title: Minimum Capital Requirements
text: Fintech companies must maintain minimum paid-up capital of QAR 10,000,000 for full banking licenses, or QAR 5,000,000 for limited payment service licenses. Capital adequacy must be demonstrated through audited financial statements.

title: Cybersecurity Standards
text: Implementation of ISO 27001 or equivalent cybersecurity framework is required. Regular penetration testing, incident response plans, and annual security audits must be documented and submitted to QCB.

title: Customer Due Diligence (CDD)
text: Enhanced Customer Due Diligence (CDD) procedures must be implemented for all customers, including identity verification, beneficial ownership identification, and ongoing monitoring of transactions.

title: Corporate Governance
text: Fintech firms must establish a qualified Board of Directors with at least 3 members, including independent directors. Board composition and governance framework must be submitted for QCB approval.
